ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: This is a new version of the 'userfriendlyscience' package, which has grown a bit unwieldy. Therefore, distinct functionalities are being 'consciously uncoupled' into different packages. This package contains the general-purpose tools and utilities (see the 'behaviorchange' package, the 'rosetta' package, and the soon-to-be-released 'scd' package for other functionality), and is the most direct 'successor' of the original 'userfriendlyscience' package. For example, this package contains a number of basic functions to create higher level plots, such as diamond plots, to easily plot sampling distributions, to generate confidence intervals, to plan study sample sizes for confidence intervals, and to do some basic operations such as (dis)attenuate effect size estimates.

This is a new version of the 'userfriendlyscience' package, which has grown a bit unwieldy. Therefore, distinct functionalities are being 'consciously uncoupled' into different packages. This package contains the general-purpose tools and utilities (see the 'behaviorchange' package, the 'rosetta' package, and the soon-to-be-released 'scd' package for other functionality), and is the most direct 'successor' of the original 'userfriendlyscience' package. For example, this package contains a number of basic functions to create higher level plots, such as diamond plots, to easily plot sampling distributions, to generate confidence intervals, to plan study sample sizes for confidence intervals, and to do some basic operations such as (dis)attenuate effect size estimates.

name: r-ufs
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "25.7.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-ufs
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ufs_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ufs/ufs_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: fa728341942d9627d1e22fe29171c557926067b5c993c5efea03e5e98422cee7

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-digest >=0.6.19
    - r-diptest >=0.75.7
    - r-dplyr >=0.7.6
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.2.1
    - r-ggrepel >=0.8
    - r-ggridges >=0.5.0
    - r-gparotation
    - r-gridextra >=2.3
    - r-gtable >=0.2.0
    - r-htmltools >=0.4.0
    - r-kableextra >=1.1.0
    - r-knitr >=1.22
    - r-pander >=0.6.3
    - r-plyr >=1.8.4
    - r-pwr
    - r-rmdpartials >=0.5.8
    - r-scales >=1.0.0
    - r-suppdists >=1.1.9
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-digest >=0.6.19
    - r-diptest >=0.75.7
    - r-dplyr >=0.7.6
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.2.1
    - r-ggrepel >=0.8
    - r-ggridges >=0.5.0
    - r-gparotation
    - r-gridextra >=2.3
    - r-gtable >=0.2.0
    - r-htmltools >=0.4.0
    - r-kableextra >=1.1.0
    - r-knitr >=1.22
    - r-pander >=0.6.3
    - r-plyr >=1.8.4
    - r-pwr
    - r-rmdpartials >=0.5.8
    - r-scales >=1.0.0
    - r-suppdists >=1.1.9

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ufs')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ufs')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://r-packages.gitlab.io/ufs
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: This is a new version of the 'userfriendlyscience' package, which has grown a bit unwieldy. Therefore, distinct functionalities are being 'consciously uncoupled' into different packages. This package contains the general-purpose tools and utilities (see the 'behaviorchange' package, the 'rosetta' package, and
    the soon-to-be-released 'scd' package for other functionality), and is the most direct 'successor' of the original 'userfriendlyscience' package. For example, this package contains a number of basic functions to create higher level plots, such as diamond plots, to easily plot sampling distributions, to generate confidence
    intervals, to plan study sample sizes for confidence intervals, and to do some basic operations such as (dis)attenuate effect size estimates.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: ufs
# Type: Package
# Title: Quantitative Analysis Made Accessible
# Version: 0.3.1
# Date: 2019-8-22
# Authors@R: person(given = "Gjalt-Jorn", family = "Peters", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "gjalt-jorn@userfriendlyscience.com", comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-0336-9589"))
# Maintainer: Gjalt-Jorn Peters <gjalt-jorn@userfriendlyscience.com>
# License: GPL (>= 3)
# Description: This is a new version of the 'userfriendlyscience' package, which has grown a bit unwieldy. Therefore, distinct functionalities are being 'consciously uncoupled' into different packages. This package contains the general-purpose tools and utilities (see the 'behaviorchange' package, the 'rosetta' package, and the soon-to-be-released 'scd' package for other functionality), and is the most direct 'successor' of the original 'userfriendlyscience' package. For example, this package contains a number of basic functions to create higher level plots, such as diamond plots, to easily plot sampling distributions, to generate confidence intervals, to plan study sample sizes for confidence intervals, and to do some basic operations such as (dis)attenuate effect size estimates.
# URL: https://r-packages.gitlab.io/ufs
# BugReports: https://gitlab.com/r-packages/ufs/issues
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# Depends: R (>= 3.0.0)
# Suggests: bootES (>= 1.2), lavaan (>= 0.6), MBESS (>= 4.5.1), psych (>= 1.8), rio (>= 0.5), rmarkdown
# Imports: digest (>= 0.6.19), diptest (>= 0.75.7), dplyr (>= 0.7.6), GGally (>= 1.4.0), ggplot2 (>= 2.2.1), ggrepel (>= 0.8), ggridges (>= 0.5.0), grDevices (>= 3.0.0), gridExtra (>= 2.3), gtable (>= 0.2.0), knitr (>= 1.22), pander (>= 0.6.3), plyr (>= 1.8.4), scales (>= 1.0.0), SuppDists (>= 1.1.9), viridis (>= 0.5.1)
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# NeedsCompilation: no

# Date/Publication: 2019-08-22 17:30:02 UTC
